content.description: This is the obvious crack on the left-hand side of the southwest face. It starts off the slabby ledge shared with Schwee. Scramble up a short offwidth and then move into a shallow, right trending, hand crack. This low-angle crack doesn't jam particularly well and mostly involves off-balance awkwardness as you "walk" up it.
Crack to face (2 bolts) to 2 bolt anchor. Located on formation just left of Laugh Rock
content.protection: med to large pro, plus a couple of QDs for the bolts.
content.location: On a formation left of Laugh rock. west face.

climbs.name: Schwee
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Betsy Dolge & Keith Kuerzel, December 1991

content.description: This is the short, 3 bolt face to the right of What A Joke.

climbs.name: Need to Have a Word With Myself
climbs.fa: Bill & Michelle Cramer, Chuck Bowker, March 1990

content.description: Fairly typical slab to an interesting exit on horizontals.
content.location: This is the bolted line left of Leaping Creamer.  Above the last bolt the route follows horizontals left then right to a crack finish.

climbs.name: Leaping Creamer (aka Sometimes We Crack Ourselves Up)

content.description: On the right side of the west face you will see two cracks very close together. This route climbs the left crack. Climb the crack straight up to a ledge. This crack splits about a quarter of the way up. You can climb the straight in crack on the right, or lieback a flake on the left. Both options end at the same place. You could actually climb both cracks at the same time.To descend, after leaving the belay ledge, climb straight up for ten feet to an easy slab with small dishes. Climb this to the top. There are two rap stations on the top, but one has quarter inch bolts. Rap off to the west with one rope.
content.protection: Small to medium gear. Small to large cams for anchor. This route shares the same belay station as Crack Worthy.

content.description: On the right side of the west face, you will see two cracks. This route climbs the right crack. Climb the crack to a roof. Move left to another crack and then up to a ledge. Belay from here. The roof is an alternate finish, but is 5.10?
content.protection: This crack takes excellent small to medium gear.The anchor takes medium to large cams.
